description: Least power k for which n^k reversed is a prime, or 0 if impossible.
mathematica: Do[ If[ Mod[ n, 3 ] != 0 && Mod[ n, 10 ] != 0 && Mod[ n, 11 ] != 0, k = 1; While[ !PrimeQ[ ToExpression[ StringReverse[ ToString[ n^k ] ] ] ], k++ ]; Print[ k ], Print[ 0 ] ], {n, 2, 75} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 17 2001
